You left the house in excellent condition and you were very caring and respecting about our property and its surroundings. We wish you the best! We cannot wait to have you back! Greetings from Bill and Stavros! Show more

Justus April 2018 First of all: the house is highly recommended. There were four of us (parents and adult sons) there in April. Corfu is great and especially easy to discover in the off-season  as there are few tourists on the otherwise quickly crowded island. The house is located in Ano Korakiana  an old village where there is practically no tourist. The village is located on a slope and so from the terrace you have a great view of the Corfu city bay  the sea and Ano Korakiana. In the village there are two or three very small shops  but already in Ipsos there is a larger supermarket (AB-market). Unfortunately  there is no restaurant in the village  but also in Ipsos (e.g. Moby Dick with good Greek cuisine). Parking is done with the rental car  which is almost necessary  in a central parking lot in the village and you then walk about two minutes to the house. The villagers are very friendly  as are Max and his family  who look after the house on site and speak German. It makes you feel like you've known each other for a long time. The old house was lovingly renovated two years ago and consists of a large modern kitchen (it really has everything  also dishwasher and washing machine) with dining table  a living room with fireplace and well-stocked bookshelf (+TV)  a large bedroom with master bed on the ground floor and two smaller twin rooms upstairs. Large closets! There are also two bathrooms with shower. Our only criticism here is actually our only criticism  as the bathrooms have not been completely renovated. Showering in the bathtub offers little comfort and there is no window or ventilation. However  everything is clean and towels are sufficiently provided. In the kitchen and in the two upper bedrooms there is an air conditioner with which you can also heat well. The fireplace also has a fan (instructions may be helpful here). The outdoor area has a large terrace with said view and two more shady spots behind the house. The garden with many plants and especially the adjacent wall remnants of old houses  which are covered with ivy  create a great atmosphere. A sphere grill is provided. We can recommend the house to anyone who does not want to stay in the direct hustle and bustle of tourist beach resorts. The ambiance of old house and modern is really successful. Jamie April 2022 The place was fantastic and Tony/Julia were very welcoming and helpful. The views are incredible and the siting of the pool is unrivalled! The house is approximately a 15min walk down to Kalami. There is a footpath starting just over the road but I would suggest good footwear as it can be slippery and probably best not attempted at night.  The only negatives were completely out of Tony's/Julia's control so for advice only:  We travelled in March/April and were really unfortunate with the weather (storms/rain/cloudy) so the the house was a little cold to begin with. There are heaters in the house but as with most Mediterranean homes the floors are tiled so remain cold to the touch. My advice is to bring socks  we came with a slightly optimistic wardrobe.  Corfu has a surplus of cats (whether they are owned or stray is unclear) and there were several hanging about begging for food and we once caught one sneeking into the kitchen to help themselves to leftovers. They seem friendly but best to make sure food is not left out.  People have mentioned the steep drive and struggle with access. We had a fairly large car and managed ok.  If you're travelling before May it's important to note that all the restaurants and supermarkets in the walkable villages are shut. The closest we found were either in Kassiopi or Ipsos but for a proper shop you're best heading to Lidl in Corfu Town.  Tap water shouldn't be drunk unless boiled. Tony has a water cooler and replacement bottles for a small fee or you can buy bottled water in the supermarkets (about €1 for 6 big 1.5l bottles). Sandie September 2022 Do not hesitate to book this Villa. Gorgeous from top to bottom and every detail is beautifully thought out. Kevin August 2022 We have just returned from a week stay in Julia and George's amazing villa. We have stayed at several other Air BnBs in Greece and Majorca and this was a cut above the rest. The main feature is am amazing outside area with infinity pool and views across the Adriatic to Albania. The inside has an a very well appointed kitchen with stocks of the basics such as oil  herbs  tea  coffee which are often missing from rental properties. However the main thing that made the stay special were the hosts  Julia and George. It is very obvious that this is their home  not just a holiday rental  and they have put a lot of love into making it a lovely place to stay. Julia dropped round freshly prepared food most days such as a traditional cake.  On a more practical note  the property is 1-2 km from Gouvia which is a tourist town with small beach and lots of restaurants. It is 20 min drive to Corfu Town with easy parking  historic streets and shops. I would say a car is essential  supermarket and restaurants are not quite within walking distance.  Overall  the best property we have ever rented  I would recommend. Show more

Mark August 2022 Wow. Just wow. If your looking for a home with breathtaking views  kind and attentive hosts and a space that just oozes creativity and love then Julia and George’s is the one for you.  Xenonerantzia is just a stunning villa that blends in beautifully to the luscious green hillside.  Each and every room is beautifully decorated and contains countless pieces of hand carved art made by its owner George that gives the whole space a real creative family vibe. The piano and board games is the lounge room were a particular highlight.  The outside spaces are just to die for. Judith October 2017 The house of Stathis and his wife is located in a small  sleepy mountain village with beautiful views of the bay of Agios Gordios. Half an hour from the airport by car (taxi price 45 euros). We (couple from Hanover) still had beautiful summer weather (23 degrees) in October. The island of Corfu is incredibly green. The west coast is very beautiful and often has great views of the bays. The serpentine roads are all surrounded by beautiful  old olive trees  very nice driving routes.  The village of Pentati itself has only one mini market and two taverns ("Angela" and "Sofia"). If you are looking for peace and relaxation  this is the place to be. However  it is mandatory to have a set of wheels. We had rented a scooter (125 euros for 10 days). Makis  the owner of the tavern Angela  helped us mediate. Make sure to eat there  it's super delicious. You look into the pots and you can choose what you want.  Stathis' house is typically furnished in the country. Simple  clean and with everything you need. Two separate bedrooms with air conditioning and 1x mosquito net  guest toilet  bathroom with bathtub (hot water)  washing machine  kitchen with gas stove (spices available). Small conservatory. Radio and CD player  WiFi runs great. We did not use TV. Parking available. Great balcony with amazing views.  Stathis and his wife live in the house if it is not rented out. During the rental period they live in Corfu city  but come every four days for 1.5 hours to clean the house. Both are making great efforts and are always available for questions and other concerns by email or phone.  In the garden  where you will find mandarins  lemons and herbs to pick yourself in addition to flowers  there is a great barbecue for barbecue or to make a fire. We've made great use of it. In the evenings there were cute cats who brought you company.  Pentati Beach (pebble beach  anglers) can be reached on foot in 10 minutes via a footpath. By scooter you can also reach the bay of Agios Gordios (sandy beach) in 10 minutes. Here it is touristy. Many restaurants  bars and shops can be found here. Here  food is a bit more expensive  it is better to drive to nearby Agios Matteos to "Coop". They serve fresh meat  too.  We only missed a sun lounger in the garden. The Hollywood swing and the hammock shown in the pictures no longer exist.  Tip: Sinarades and Kato Garouna are cute and still very original villages. Issos beach in the south is a great stretch of beach  recommended. Corfu city is a must  anyway  pretty town. Show more Translated from German  Show original

Steve July 2022 Our stay at Mimosa Pool Cottage in July 2022 was utterly delightful.  The accommodation was as advertised  but exceeded expectations. The cottage was generous in size  with two double bedrooms and additional sleeping space on a fold-out sofa.  Air-con was available within the kitchen-dining room  and portable fans were provided in the bedrooms.  The pool was 20 yards from the cottage  and was the perfect size and temperature.  Upon arrival  everything was spotlessly clean  and Alice (the host) was there to meet & greet us. Alice’s welcome was very hospitable and she showed us around the accommodation  providing lots of information and insight.  Communication with Alice throughout our stay was predominantly via WhatsApp  which was perfect for us. Alice lives on site in another villa  and responded to texts promptly  but also gave us space to enjoy the cottage and surrounding garden & pool on our own. At no point did we feel crowded; quite the reverse - Alice was a true 'super host'  helping when needed  and providing privacy at all other times.  An example of Alice's reassuring presence was when we borrowed two bicycles to cycle into the local village. There were initially no locks for the bikes  but after texting Alice  some brand new locks were left outside the cottage 15 minutes later  after her husband had driven off to the local supermarket to buy some.  The accommodation is a 5 minute drive (or 30 minute walk) along a quiet road  to the local town of Gouvia  where there are bars & restaurants  a supermarket  plus a bus stop which takes you into Corfu town (20 minute bus ride).  Gouvia also has a beach with motor boat hire and pleasure cruise trips departing.  All in all  this was a fantastic place to stay which we would highly recommend. We look forward to returning in the near future for another holiday on the beautiful island of Corfu.  Thank you for everything Alice ❤️. Show more

Grant July 2015 this was our first air bnb experience. i wouldn't say we were nervous about it  but like any first experience you want it to go well. every time we checked in with christos or anthony their response was immediate  so before we even arrived in corfu we felt like we were being looked after.  the apartment is exactly as it is described  on the beachfront at glyfada beach. it was just my wife and i so the apartment more than accommodated our needs. it's two story  with a kitchen and large living room downstairs and the two bedrooms upstairs. there's A/C throughout and a balcony both upstairs and downstairs to take in the views.  anthony met us on arrival and could not have done any more to make us feel welcome  including the offer of a lovely bottle of greek wine. he lived close by and made it very clear to us we could contact him for any need. this is extremely reassuring when you're away from home.  glyfada itself offers all you could want. it is set up as a tourist beach - plenty of sunbeams and umbrellas as well as water sports and activities. in chatting with some of the waiters we got to know in tavernas there  it seems it's not as "touristy" as some of the other beaches on corfu and is more popular with the greeks than anyone else. there are also quieter parts of the beach where you can swim and sit on the beach without feeling like you're part of the throng. this suited my wife and i and best of all  it was the part of the beach pretty much out in front of the apartment.  there are a few mini-marts on the beach and one decent market selling all your usual needs. there's a good taverna at the right end of the beach and a few more along the main beach front. note this is not the place to come to if you want clubs or late night partying. there is a new taverna just next door which has only been open for a month or so. it pretty much dominates the beachfront both day and night. during the afternoon it tends to play dance beats to accommodate the younger crowd. by 8pm those beats are off and the vibe completely switches to chill. the restaurant here is the priciest on the beach  but the ambience is something else.  we had a great time on glyfada and would not hesitate to recommend anthony and christos as hosts. The suite is quite large to feel comfortable even for a few days! It is the size of many apartments in New York and Amsterdam. Second  the pool and view are absolutely stunning. It was lovely to have the option to wake up and go right into the pool  cool down in the pool after hiking from Porto Timoni beach or sitting on the lounge chairs to read while looking out at an amazing view. Third  the location is just fabulous. There are tons of restaurants nearby including Zeus Thone’s own restaurant  a great sunset look out point  a beach nearby to rent a boat for the day  a couple of hiking options and a village to explore. You could easily spend a few days here without going to any other part of Corfu. Lastly  the staff and service is impeccable. Vasilis  Mario and the rest of the staff made us feel at home. They were attentive without being overbearing and gave us the utmost privacy and help. You will be so full from the free breakfast included; the portions are large. If you eat at Zeus Throne’s restaurant  get a grilled fish and grilled vegetables! (FYI the road to the hotel is narrow and can only fit one car. Sometimes when we were driving in and out  I’d get out of the car and walk ahead to see if another car was there  then signal to my husband that he could drive through.) Show more

Emiliano August 2020 Probably no apartment is ever perfect but some of them are so great that let you disregard the very little issues they have. Vista del Mar is such an apartment. A few issues: as you already know  it is near  VERY near the airport and be sure you will hear all of the incoming flights. But that's also a fantastic opportunity for a lot  a LOT of great creative pictures you can take from the garden. With a very very few exceptions  all the flights are during the day and won't wake you up. There are mosquitoes but Alexandra leaves you with a full range of weapons against it and I found one of the sprays particularly effective to prevent bites (and I am a favourite target of mosquitoes..) When I was there there were a couple of cats (among the several cats inhabiting the whole island) that felt particularly at home in the garden. This can be a gigantic plus if you have cat-lover kids or spouse or it can be a nuisance if you don't particularly like felines (I am allergic to them). So you decide! There is a rather near Market  not particularly big but acceptable and the farthest one with more stuff. That's great. Unfoertunately the road to reach them is treacherous if you go walking. No problem if you have a car. That's it! the rest is great  really! First and foremost  the view... ahhh the view from the garden is amazing. Just get up at about 7 and enjoy a great sunrise each and every day. The garden is small  well kept  with nice long chairs and after around noon it starts being in the shade and it is amazing for relaxing. In less than a minute you walk to a basically private beach. it's not the best beach in the world but it shares the same view  it is safe and the water itself is crystal clear. You can easily swim to the island of Pontikonissi without paying for the ferry. You can catch crabs  snorkel for fishes. There are a few restaurants nearby  one is literally less than 30 steps from your door and it also sports a replica of Tommy Lee Jones posing as a waiter. Our personal recommendation is Alkinos though: 10 minutes walk but prices are lower and the lady serving you is exquisite.  Back to Vista del Mar: there are beds for 4 people  a double for adults and two couches. We managed to have our tallest kid (180+ cm) sleeping comfortably in one of them with no problems. There is also something to play but we never used it. The kitchen is small and I wouldn't use it if I had to cook all days but it was furnished with almost everything we needed for simple cooking. Dishwasher and Washing machines are working ok. Inside the house  Wifi is doing perfectly. In the garden  of course  the signal is weaker but still usable if you don't go too far. Around the house  there are other tools and things we didn't even had the time to explore.  To reach Corfu without a car you have two possible paths: the longest one with Bus #6 (Corfu - Benitses) or passing the bridge (in itself already a must do experience!) and take the Bus #2a (Corfu - Kanoni)... you can also walk from Kanoni to Corfu in less than an hour  the path is often in the shade too and not too risky.  Finally  Alexandra was really perfect  an exquisite host that immediately answered all of my anxious questions for the months prior to the trip and during our stay. She also left several products on the table and the fridge to welcome us and she let us stay longer the last day since we had a late ferry back.  Vista del Mar is not the cheapest place you will find around but I totally recommend it for a family with 1 or 2 young kids. Show more

Also the owner’s relatives were friendly and helpful  and even presented us with a basket of homegrown tomatoes and vegetables. It should be noted that though the listing says two bathrooms  in fact only one has a bath and shower  the other has just a toilet and sink (though there is a shower fitting). We through that the listing rather gives the impression of two bathrooms and I had asked for confirmation of this before we booked  as we were a party of four adults and two children  and another shower/bathroom was really needed.
